title: PythonFile Methods

metadata.description: Learn about PythonFile Methods with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Python has a set of methods available for the file object.
Method
Description
close()
Closes the file
detach()
Returns the separated 
    raw stream from the buffer
fileno()
Returns a number that 
    represents the stream, from the operating system's perspective
flush()
Flushes the internal 
    buffer
isatty()
Returns whether the 
    file stream is interactive or not
read()
Returns the file content
readable()
Returns whether 
    the file stream can be read or not
readline()
Returns one line 
    from the file
readlines()
Returns a list 
    of lines from the file
seek()
Change the file position
seekable()
Returns whether 
    the file allows us to change the file position
tell()
Returns the current file 
    position
truncate()
Resizes the file 
    to a specified size
writable()
Returns whether 
    the file can be written to or not
write()
Writes the specified 
    string to the file
writelines()
Writes a list 
    of strings to the file
Learn more about the file object in our
Python File Handling Tutorial
.

★
+1

practice_exercises.description: Create a function that demonstrates the concepts from this tutorial.

summary: This tutorial covers PythonFile Methods concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PythonFile Methods effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PythonFile Methods and how to apply it in your projects.
